entry_title: What is AT&T Stadium? The site for Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson boxing fight, explained
entry_summary: A fight like Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson requires a massive venue. Here is all you need to know about the colossal stadium that will host this event.
entry_content: Daniel Yanofsky Jake Paul and Mike Tyson will compete in a crossover fight for the ages on November 15. All eyes will be on them when they clash on a card featuring world title bouts and young prospects.  Tyson returns to the ring for his first pro fight since 2005. The former two-time world champion knocked out 44 opponents in his professional career, using his power and speed to dismantle the competition. He looks to prove he can still compete at 58.  The Hall of Famer faces the 27-year-old Paul, a novice in the sport compared to Tyson. "The Problem Child" is 2-1 against legitimate boxers, but Tyson is considered by many to be his most formidable test. A YouTuber, Paul is ready to entertain those watching him in person and the millions expected to watch on Netflix.   MORE: How much will Jake Paul and Mike Tyson make for their fight? Tyson competed in various arenas during his career, from Madison Square Garden to the Tokyo Dome. Paul has fought at Staples Center and the biggest indoor arena in Puerto Rico. Regardless of its unorthodox nature, a fight like Paul vs. Tyson deserves a massive venue.  Here is all you need to know about Paul vs. Tyson, including the location of the event. Paul vs. Tyson is in AT&T Stadium, home to the Dallas Cowboys. The stadium, which opened in 2009, can hold up to 80,000 people. It can expand to over 100,000 people and has a retractable roof.  The address for the stadium is 1 AT&T Way, Arlington, TX 76011. Needless to say, Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson will be a spectacle.  Ticket prices for the event start at $56 via StubHub.  BUY NOW: Cheapest ticket prices for Paul vs. Tyson Prices then range from $60, $70, $80, $90, $100, $200, $300, $400, $500, $600, $700, $800, $900, $1,000, $2,000, $3,000, $4,000, $5,000, $6,000, $7,000, $8,000, $9,000, $1,000, $11,000, $12,000, $13,000, $14,000, $17,000, $22,000, $23,000, $29,000 $31,000, $37,000, and $350,224.  Here's the seating map for AT&T Stadium:  All bags must be clear plastic, vinyl or PVC (12x6x12 measurements). You can also bring a small clutch bag into AT&T Stadium (4.5x6.5x2 measurements).  AT&T Stadium does not offer a bag valet service, but it does have mobile lockers for guests with bags that don't meet the stadium's bag policy. The lockers are located in parking lots five and nine, and the rental fee is $20.  If you have questions about specific prohibited and approved bags, visit the AT&T Stadium website.  There are nearly 12,000 parking spots distributed among 15 numbered lots at AT&T Stadium. Parking is also available at the Texas Ranger Ballpark on event days, which is walking distance from AT&T. You can purchase parking passes in advance for events at AT&T Stadium via Seatgeek, which helps to avoid higher parking rates on-site.  Parking lots typically open five hours before the start of Cowboys games. Specific times for other events can be found on the AT&T Stadium website.  Parking at AT&T Stadium can cost anywhere between $20 and $125 on game and event days, depending on the type of parking and location. Tailgating is permitted in the grassy areas on the perimeters of parking lots 4-7 and 10-15, and are filled on a first-come first-served basis. Tailgating is not permitted in lots 3, 8 or 9.  If you are using a rideshare app, taxi or bus service to travel to an event at AT&T Stadium, you can direct the vehicle to the designated drop-off and pick-up zones. Taxis and general pick-up is available at the far west end of Miller LiteHouse off of North Collins Street and Cowboys Way. Taxis are staged at this location before and after events. Rideshare pick-up and drop-off will be located at lot 15. There is no direct public transportation to AT&T Stadium, but visitors can take the TRE Commuter Rail line to Centreport Station and then take a taxi from there. It is about a 10-minute drive from Centreport to AT&T. There are several hotels within minutes of AT&T Stadium. The two closest are Live! by Loews Hotel and Loews Arlington Hotel and Convention Center, which are right across the street from the venue with views of the stadium. The Drury Plaza Hotel Dallas Arlington and the Sheraton Arlington Hotel are also good options, both within a mile of AT&T.  If you purchase a product or register for an account through one of the links on our site, we may receive compensation. entry_title: Why have Paraguay banned Lionel Messi shirts? Jersey row explained
entry_summary: Fans wearing any version of a soccer jersey bearing the megastar's name will be denied entry to the upcoming match.
entry_content: Liam Happe (Prensa Argentina) Paraguay host Argentina in an important 2026 World Cup qualfication fixture on Thursday, but the eve of the showdown was awash with controversial news involving the visiting team's star player, Lionel Messi. Argentina currently lead the South American qualification table despite the odd wobble so far, but will want to avoid any further slip-ups to ensure a strong finish towards the defence of their 2022 crown. Paraguay, meanwhile, have recently moved into the sixth and final qualification berth and know a win at home to one of their strongest rivals will go a long way towards sealing their participation. MORE: All the latest soccer action | Lionel Messi news Ahead of the contest at Estadio Defensores del Chaco in Asuncion, Fernando Villasboa, manager of the Paraguayan Football Federation, announced the following: "Fans wearing jerseys of the Argentine national team, Barcelona, PSG, or Inter Miami with Lionel Messi's name on the back will not be allowed entry to the stadium. "It's not about Messi or any specific player. We respect the careers of all footballers. It's just that the home ground is very important to us." The Paraguay team coach, Gustavo Alfaro, responded diplomatically to the news. "I had no idea about that," he said. "The idea, I think, is just to reduce any potential sources of conflict." "I hope Messi has the best game of his life against Peru-but not tomorrow." The ban seems, as touched upon by Alfaro, to be related to a genuine fear that local fans will be more inclined to support global megastar Messi than their own country's team. Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni acknowleged this in response to the news, saying: "Logically, for the Paraguayan footballer, for the fan, they all want to wear the national team shirt. "But Leo [Messi] is stronger than all that, and there will be Argentina shirts. "It doesn't mean they don't support Paraguay. I think it's good that football people recognize what he is. "And it's not because you have a shirt that you become an Argentina fan." Messi is with the Argentina squad, appears to be fully fit to play and as a result, is of course expected to be in the starting XI. The anticipation of his involvement may be what can trigger some Paraguay fans to show their love of Messi at the game, leading to the late decision by the hosts. MORE: Where to watch Paraguay vs. Argentina, expected lineups Liam is a freelance editor for The Sporting News working across global English editions.

entry_title: Where did Jayden Daniels go to college? Revisiting LSU, Arizona State stats and why he transferred
entry_summary: Before Washington Commanders' quarterback Jayden Daniels was lighting up NFL defenses, he was playing college football. A look back at his collegiate career, starting at Arizona State and ending at LSU.
entry_content: Morgan Moriarty Washington Commanders quarterback Jayden Daniels is well on his way to running away with the NFL's Rookie of the Year Award in 2024. On the season, he's thrown for 2,147 yards, run for 464 yards, and posted 13 total TDs to just two turnovers while leading the Commanders to a 7-4 start and putting them on pace for the franchise's best start since 2012.  As the legend of Daniels' young career continues to grow, many might want to learn more about his backstory and journey to becoming a No. 2 overall pick and rising NFL star. In college, Daniels' career actually started at Arizona State — not LSU, where he won the Heisman Trophy. Let's run through Daniels' college career and find out what made him into Washington's franchise quarterback. NFL HQ: Live NFL scores | Updated NFL standings | Full NFL schedule Daniels played college football at both Arizona State and LSU. His collegiate journey started in his hometown of San Bernardino, Calif. The former 4-star recruit was the nation's No. 2 ranked dual-threat quarterback from the class of 2019.  Despite having offers from the likes of USC, Tennessee, Penn State, Ohio State, and several others, the signal-caller opted to play at Arizona State. Daniels stepped on campus as an early enrollee in Jan. 2019.  The QB committed to then-head coach Herm Edwards' class of 2019 as the highest-rated prospect in his class.  "The team is young," Daniels said via The Arizona Republic of his decision to commit to ASU.  "So, showing they play the younger freshmen, playing the best players. They want people that want to win and play at the next level, so just showing that, that’s something I want to be a part of." The Sun Devils' coaching staff remained committed to playing young players after Daniels' arrival. The quarterback won the starting job before Arizona State's 2019 season as a true freshman.  "He doesn't put the ball in jeopardy and he sees the field are the two main things," ASU offensive coordinator Rob Likens said of the decision. "For his age and hasn't had a lot of experience in college except for spring practice, his ability to make quick decisions with the speed that is going on around him and his ability to adjust from the high school speed to the college speed was nothing I've ever seen before." MORE: NFL playoff picture | NFL power rankings | Week 11 NFL picks | Week NFL picks against the spread Daniels' numbers were a bit of a mixed bag in Tempe. The Sun Devils also only played four games during the shortened COVID-19 season in 2020, too.  Season  Comp-Att Pass. Yards TDs INTs 2019 205-338 2,943 17 1 2020 49-84 701 5 1 2021 197-301 2,380 10 10 Over three seasons, he rushed for 1,288 yards with 13 touchdowns. Here's a look at how Arizona State fared in those three seasons:  His third and final season with the Sun Devils was overshadowed by some controversy surrounding the program. In June 2021, the NCAA placed Arizona State under investigation for having recruits on campus during a 2020 dead period. Although Daniels' mother, Regina, was tied to some of ASU's alleged recruiting violations, Daniels was said to be uninvolved and therefore was never disciplined or investigated by the NCAA.   In addition to the recruiting controversy and disappointing junior season, Arizona State's recruiting class struggled significantly, finishing 103rd overall as the Sun Devils lost 17 players to the transfer portal. Despite initially indicating that he would be returning, Daniels entered the transfer portal in Feb. 2022. ASU also had plenty of coaching turnover stemming from the NCAA investigation, including offensive coordinator Zak Hill's resignation.  At the time, Daniels was entering a pretty crowded quarterback room. Already on LSU's roster included then-redshirt freshman and current Tigers starting quarterback Garrett Nussmeier and true freshman Walker Howard. Sixth-year senior Myles Brennan was also expected to compete for the starting job, too. When fall camp arrived, the battle had narrowed down to Nussmeier and Daniels. Walker was expected to take a redshirt, and Brennan decided to walk away from football in what was an injury-riddled career for him.   Comp-Att Pass Yards TDs INTs Passer Rating Rush Yards Rushing TDs 236-327 3,812 40 4 208 1,134 10 Daniels helped lead LSU to a 10-win season and a berth in the SEC Championship Game. His numbers were similar to his first season at Arizona State. He finished 266-for-388 with 2,913 yards passing, 17 touchdowns, and just three interceptions. He rushed for 885 yards and 11 touchdowns, which were career-high numbers for him at the time. LSU finished 10-4, losing to Georgia in the SEC Championship game but beating Purdue in the Citrus Bowl. That was only a taste of what was to come. Daniels took the college football world by storm during his "super senior" season in 2023. He set numerous NCAA, school, and SEC records, including:  LSU finished 10-3 and won the ReliaQuest Bowl over Wisconsin. The Florida game pretty much won him the Heisman weeks before the award was handed out. Pretty much every single one of his plays in that game were jaw-dropping:  “If (Daniels) didn’t win (the Heisman Trophy) tonight, he has got to be the leading candidate,” LSU head coach Brian Kelly said after the game. “Unless the Heisman is just about popularity. If you want to be the most popular then fine, but he is the best player in college football. “He did something tonight that no one has ever done. If that doesn’t make you the leading candidate, then maybe the Heisman isn’t really for the best player.”Clearly, Heisman voters agreed. A few weeks later, Daniels took home the award, beating out fellow quarterback Michael Penix Jr. from Washington.    Morgan Moriarty joined The Sporting News as a content producer in the fall of 2024. Her sports journalism career started at the University of Florida in 2012, where she graduated in 2015. She has covered college football and basketball, the NFL and numerous other major sports for outlets like the Tampa Bay Times, Saturday Down South, UPROXX Sports and SB Nation. She also covers college football for Bleacher Report, and is a featured guest on various CNN programs.

entry_title: Carlos Prates says he smokes ten cigarettes a day, even on fight day
entry_summary: Newly ranked UFC welterweight Carlos Prates told Ariel Helwani on Helwani's live show on Tuesday that he smokes ten cigarettes daily, even on fight days.
entry_content: Val Dewar Newly ranked UFC welterweight Carlos Prates told Ariel Helwani on Helwani's live show on Tuesday that he smokes ten cigarettes daily, even on fight days.  This is crazy... Carlos Prates shares he currently smokes around 8 cigarettes a day! 🚬"I smoked before I came to the Apex because you can't smoke there."#HelwaniShow pic.twitter.com/jXmdRgHXjF Prates is in the process of becoming a star for his four straight walk-off knockout wins to begin his UFC career, all in 2024. He is one of a number of budding talents from Brazil's 'Fighting Nerds' gym.  Although he has only been in the UFC for a year, jokes about Prates and his ability to be a high-level fighter while smoking are already widespread amongst MMA fans.  Obviously, smoking cigarettes — and most forms of inhaling nicotine/tobacco — is scientifically proven to be detrimental to one's lung health, so not something most health and performance experts would recommend.  However, MMA fighters have never been known for taking conventional routes forward in their careers.   Prates is from Taubate, Sao Paulo, Brazil and has been fighting on the streets since he was young, according to himself, as well as smoking since age 12.  If this is what works for him, then more power to him for his ability to live his life how he sees fit. He knows the potential consequences.  Val was initiated into Steelers Nation from the moment he was born — his first memory is a game vs. New England from when "Slash" was QB — and doing sports writing has always been a dream career for him. In 2022 he broke into the industry by writing about combat sports for Cageside Press, and now has the opportunity to continue that work with TSN as an MMA writer, as well as get his feet wet on the Steelers beat.

entry_title: NFL picks, predictions against the spread Week 11: Chiefs burn Bills; Steelers stun Ravens; Bengals beat Chargers
entry_summary: In Sporting News' latest weekly game picks and predictions against the spread for Week 11, the Eagles survive the Commanders while the Chiefs, Steelers, and Bengals are among those teams who win virtual tossup games.
entry_content:
Vinnie Iyer The arrival of Week 11 means there are two months left in the 2024 NFL regular season. That's plenty of time for Sporting News' weekly picks and predcitions against the spread to finish strong. With the weather getting colder and more injury attrition hitting teams, our fearless forecasting is even more challenging. Here's diving in again to navigate those waters with every intention of staying well afloat. BETTING INFO & INSIGHT: Bet $5, Get $200 guaranteed with our FanDuel promo  |  TD scorer props and SGPs at DraftKings and FanDuel  |  Best NFL betting sites (Odds courtesy of Caesars Sportsbook) 

 SN's NFL HQ: Live NFL scores | Updated NFL standings | Full NFL schedule  Thursday 8:15 p.m. ET, Amazon Prime Video The Commanders' defense has been overachieving under coach Dan Quinn, but they are still vulnerable to downfield passing. The Eagles have been hot with Jalen Hurts spreading and stretching the field. Jayden Daniels can answer with some big plays of his own, playing off his team's own strong traditional rushing attack. Philadelphia has a little more firepower to outlast Washington in a thriller at home.  Pick: Eagles win 27-24 but fail to cover the spread. MORE: Johnny Newton in tears over late-game mistake vs. Steelers Sunday 4:25 p.m. ET, CBS The Chiefs' defense will catch another break here with Josh Allen's key receivers hurting, which will lessen the burden after they contain the Bills' running game. Kansas City has done what's needed to win every game through offense, defense, and special teams. The team that has the cleaner game and is pressured into fewer turnovers will win, and the Chiefs will make a strong statement that they remain the clear AFC team to beat. Pick: Chiefs win 23-20. MORE: How Chiefs stayed perfect | Did Patrick Mahomes ask ref for help? | Taylor Swift meets with ref before Chiefs game Sunday 4:05 p.m. ET, Fox The 49ers' offense got going a lot more with Christian McCaffrey in the lineup against the Buccaneers, and they will finish better in the red zone in his second game back. McCaffrey and Brock Purdy tend to crush it together at home, and the Seahawks' reeling defense won't be much improved after a bye. Geno Smith will do his best to pass Seattle into the game, but San Francisco is more loaded in the more favorable matchup. Pick: 49ers win 34-17 and cover the spread. MORE: CMC is back — and so is 49ers' Super Bowl offense | Deebo Samuel explains spat with teammates Sunday 1 p.m. ET, CBS The Steelers' quarterback plan has been executed to perfection, as they turned it over to Russell Wilson at the right time to rev up the deep passing game and also open up the traditional running game. Pittsburgh can pick apart Baltimore's pass defense in the short-to-intermediate middle. The Ravens can answer well with their running game and Lamar Jackson's complementary mobility, but the hosts score the first big early win in the two-team AFC North race between the archrivals. Pick: Steelers win 27-24. MORE STEELERS: Russell Wilson validates Mike Tomlin's QB decision with win over Commanders MORE RAVENS: Kyle Hamilton injury update | Derrick Henry wardrobe malfunction  Sunday 1 p.m. ET, Fox The Packers will be coming back from a bye with better play from Jordan Love, who will be supported well by a rested Josh Jacobs going against a weak Bears run defense. The Bears also are breaking down vs. the pass more and putting too much on Caleb Williams to carry a dysfunctional, inconsistent offense. Green Bay's defense will exploit that well. Pick: Packers in 24-13 and cover the spread. MORE: Is Matt Eberflus on hot seat? Sunday 1 p.m. ET, CBS The Jaguars are one more really bad loss away from sealing the fate of coach Doug Pederson, and it could definitely come in this unfriendly feline trip to the Lions' den. The Lions' offense survived a frustrating night in Houston and will be ready to explode vs. a weak defense in every which way. This is a big number in Detroit's favor, but the Lions should be relentless on offense and defense. Pick: Lions win 38-14 and cover the spread. MORE: Did Lions get away with key defensive pass interference vs. Texans? Sunday 1 p.m. ET, CBS The Vikings' defense and special teams saved them in Jacksonville on an off day for the offense despite multiple red-zone trips. Tennessee can also be a tricky AFC South trip, but Minnesota should feel confident its pass defense can cause a lot of issues for Will Levis with Brian Flores' aggressive scheming. Sam Darnold should play better, given he might be auditioning to replace Levis as the Titans' QB in 2025. Pick: Vikings win 24-19 but fail to cover the spread. MORE: Vikings taunt Jaguars' mascot after takeaways Sunday 1 p.m. ET, CBS The Raiders will be rested coming off a bye while the Dolphins are operating on a short week. Las Vegas' run defense will be the biggest concern here, as it will have loads of trouble slowing down speedy De'Von Achane. Miami's defense finally gets a break against a weaker rushing attack and passing offense that is bound to stumble, regardless of the QB. Pick: Dolphins win 24-14 and cover the spread. WEEK 11 FANTASY FOOTBALL RANKINGSQBs | RBs | WRs | TEs | D/ST | Kickers  Sunday 1 p.m. ET, Fox The Rams' defense has a superstar rookie in Jared Verse who can help put good pressure on fellow rookie Drake Maye. The Patriots' pass rush was anomalously great in Chicago, but Los Angeles likes to get the ball out quickly with Matthew Stafford. Cooper Kupp and Puka Nacua can be a downfield matchup nightmare. The Patriots, however, can make it interesting late with some more fearless playmaking, running, and passing from Maye. Pick: Rams win 20-17 but fail to cover the spread. MORE: NFL playoff picture | NFL power rankings | Week 11 NFL picks Sunday 1 p.m. ET, Fox Jameis Winston will return to New Orleans to battle the man he backed up last year, Derek Carr. The Saints played hard in their first game under interim coach Darren Rizzi, but they needed some breaks in the form of missed field-goal attempts to survive. Cleveland comes off a bye to find a few more yards through the run and pass for a mild road upset. Pick: Browns win 23-20. MORE: Interim coach Darren Rizzi explains why he expected 'crappy day' vs. Falcons Sunday 1 p.m. ET, CBS The Colts will stay in this game with Jonathan Taylor's running early, only to put Joe Flacco in more uncomfortable situations by the second half after setting up Aaron Rodgers, Garrett Wilson, and Davante Adams for a get-well outside passing game. The Jets also can shatter the Colts' porous run defense with Breece Hall. Pick: Jets win 24-13 and cover the spread. MORE: Jeff Ulbrich takes blame for loss | Is Aaron Rodgers on hot seat? Sunday 4:05 p.m. ET, Fox The Falcons are up-and-down with their offense and defense from week to week. The Broncos have a tough pass defense for Kirk Cousins, but he'll get some needed help from Bijan Robinson's red-hot running and receiving. Bo Nix doesn't have the same pop around him after the Falcons stop the run. Pick: Falcons win 24-20  Sunday 8:20 p.m. ET, NBC/Peacock The Chargers have destroyed the weaker offensive opponents on their schedule, scoring wins over the Raiders, Panthers, Broncos, Saints, Browns, and Titans. Joe Burrow, Ja'Marr Chase, and the Bengals do not fall into that category. Cincy's offense should stay hot after a mini-bye, operating in a non-hostile environment. Justin Herbert is also on fire, but in a sneaky high-scoring passing duel, trust more in the higher first-round pick from the 2020 draft. Pick: Bengals win 34-31. Monday 8:15 p.m. ET, ESPN/ABC Houston has been a bit sloppy with its passing and ball protection, and they come into the game with a two-game losing streak. Dallas was embarrassed at home in Week 10 and should put forth at least a strong defensive effort with Micah Parsons firing things up. Unfortunately, the Cowboys, with whoever's at QB, won't find enough offense, even if CeeDee Lamb can find the ball at home better under the lights. Pick: Texans win 23-19 but fail to cover the spread. MORE: Jerry Jones says Mike McCarthy's job is safe — for now | Micah Parsons not concerned about McCarthy's job If you purchase a product or register for an account through one of the links on our site, we may receive compensation.  Learn more >  Vinnie Iyer has been with The Sporting News since 1999, not long after graduating from Northwestern University’s Medill School of Journalism. He has produced NFL content for more than 20 years, turning his attention to full-time writing in 2007. Vinnie covers every aspect of the NFL for TSN including draft prospects analysis, gambling and fantasy football. He also represents TSN as host of the “Locked On Fantasy Football” podcast on the Locked On network.

entry_title: Michael ‘Venom’ Page to take on rising star Shara ‘Bullet’ Magomedov in Saudi Arabia in 2025
entry_summary: Surprising fight broke early Thursday morning  that Michael ‘Venom’ Page will be moving up to 185-lbs to fight #14 middleweight Sharaputdin Magomedov.
entry_content: Val Dewar Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-Imagn Images Surprising fight broke early Thursday morning when Red Corner MMA reported that Michael ‘Venom’ Page, aka MVP, will be moving up to 185-lbs to fight the brand new ranked middleweight, #14 Sharaputdin Magomedov, at the next UFC card in Saudi Arabia.  BREAKING: Shara Magomedov has agreed to face Michael ‘Venom’ Page in Saudi Arabia on February 1.Per his manager @Rizvan_RM pic.twitter.com/pOngqaKUsF Dagestan's one-eyed pirate Magomedov has made quite the splash since debuting in 2023, winning four straight middleweight bouts including a recent unprecedented double spinning backfist knockout over Armen Petrosyan.  ‘Bullet’ thus remains undefeated fifteen fights into his pro career but has no flagship victory just yet, one which proves his talent against a skillful veteran.  That is where MVP comes in. Not only does his style match up perfectly with Shara’s – they are both flashy, kick-heavy knockout artists with a penchant for the unusual – but he also has the distinction of having been one of rival promotion Bellator’s stars for a long time, going 17-2 in the promotion and only ever losing in title fights. Although Page's own resume is somewhat shallow, wins over Kevin Holland, Paul Daley, and Douglas Lima are far beyond any win of Magomedov’s. The collision of two lifelong martial artists and their unique styles of kicking – and spinning – in the octagon may create chaos. It may look awkward, even ugly, as can be the case when two unique specialists are both unsure how their style will work against someone as weird as themselves. It could also be an incredible fight., or at least a pretty fun one.  Whatever the case may be, it will certainly be a fight that plays out like no other. If Shara Bullet can take out MVP, however, it would be the biggest win of his career no matter how he gets it done.  Val was initiated into Steelers Nation from the moment he was born — his first memory is a game vs. New England from when "Slash" was QB — and doing sports writing has always been a dream career for him. In 2022 he broke into the industry by writing about combat sports for Cageside Press, and now has the opportunity to continue that work with TSN as an MMA writer, as well as get his feet wet on the Steelers beat.

entry_title: Slumping Aaron Rodgers isn't going away quietly
entry_summary: The New York Jets' quarterback appears determined to eventually end his Hall-of-Fame career on his own terms.
entry_content: Ralph Ventre © Joe Camporeale It hasn't gone as planned for Aaron Rodgers and the New York Jets in 2024, but the quarterback doesn't plan on aborting the mission prematurely. Despite being a near permanent fixture on the injury report, Rodgers has started all 10 games and has missed no time in his first season back from an Achilles tear. Set to turn 41 years old next month, the future Hall-of-Fame field general suggested that the Jets' struggles will not deter him from playing beyond this season. "Not for the negative," said Rodgers after Wednesday's practice as New York prepares to host the Indianapolis Colts on November 17. When asked if he still wants to play come 2025, the four-time NFL MVP sounded willing to run it back. "I think so, yeah," said Rodgers, who is under contract for one more season. With the Jets at 3-7 overall and their playoff chances dwindling, the outlook is grim for Gang Green. Meanwhile, Rodgers ranks 26th out of 32 starting quarterbacks in yards per pass (6.4). "I'm not playing as well as I would have liked to play for sure," said Rodgers. "The frustrating part is that if you're a great competitor, you hold yourself to a standard and, and it's not unrealistic and I haven't reached that standard this year. RELATED: Traded veteran WR upgrades from Aaron Rodgers to Russell Wilson Despite the Achilles injury and a lack of wins, Rodgers claims to reside in a good mental state of late. "It's been, actually, a really beautiful couple years for me in totality, but it's obviously been frustrating with the football part," said Rodgers. Rodgers is under contract through 2025, and he likely doesn't want to go out on a sour note. Unless team brass dumps him, which would result in a massive salary cap hit, it looks like the Jets will start a 41-year-old quarterback next season.           © Joe Camporeale     • Three serious candidates for Jets' head coaching job • Tyron Smith's neck injury could force Jets' rookie into starting role • Jets boot kicker after one game, sign former Packers' draft pick • Aaron Rodgers makes surprising suggestion for Mike Williams replacement • What New York Jets' plan should be in 2025 Ralph Ventre, a former college football conference administrator, brings 20 years of media experience to the New York Jets beat. Prior to concentrating on Gang Green, he covered the NCAA DI Football Championship Subdivision for NFL Draft Bible on Sports Illustrated’s FanNation. Ventre remains an official voter for the Stats Perform FCS Top 25 and the annual legacy awards. The Fordham University graduate is a member of the Pro Football Writers of America, and he also covers the Buffalo Bills on SI. The veteran sports media professional resides in his native state of New Jersey.

Ashlee Woods Brad Mills (USA Today Network) Complete control of the NFC East is on the line Thursday night, as the Eagles are set to host the Commanders in Philadelphia.  The Eagles have been on an upward trend after their bye week, rattling off five straight wins. Philadelphia enters this game on the heels of a 34-6 win over the Cowboys Sunday afternoon, the Eagles' first victory in Arlington in seven years.  Washington enters Thursday night's showdown looking to bounce back from a 28-27 loss to the Steelers Sunday afternoon. Nevertheless, the Commanders are still one of the NFL's most explosive teams, ranking fifth in scoring offense.  


STREAM:Thursday Night Football LIVE on Prime Video in the US



 STREAM:Thursday Night Football LIVE on Prime Video in the US Will Philadelphia maintain its unblemished division record? Or will Washington stop the surge? The Sporting News has everything you need to know about Eagles vs. Commanders, including TV and streaming information.  Eagles vs. Commanders will kick off at 8:15 p.m. ET on Thursday, Nov. 14 from Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia, Pa. Eagles vs. Commanders will air exclusively on Amazon Prime Video throughout the United States. Al Michaels (play-by-play), Kirk Herbstreit (color analyst) and Kaylee Hartung (sideline reporter) will call all the action. entry_title: NFL picks, predictions for Week 11: Chiefs edge Bills to stay unbeaten, Ravens knock off Steelers
entry_summary: Bill Bender breaks down his Week 11 NFL picks, including the Chiefs continuing their quest for a perfect season and the Ravens slowing down the Steelers.
entry_content: Bill Bender It's finally Bills-Chiefs week, one of the NFL's best new rivalries will be on full display in Week 11. The Bills-Chiefs rivalry revolves around the fact Buffalo traded the No. 10 pick in the 2017 NFL Draft, which the Chiefs used to draft Patrick Mahomes. This has become the rivalry that defines the AFC ever since. Kansas City and Buffalo have the two best records in the NFL since 2017.  The Chiefs have won three Super Bowls, while the Bills are still trying to break through in the postseason. The teams have met seven times since 2020, including three AFC playoff matchups which have been swept by Kansas City. Buffalo holds a 3-1 advantage in regular-season matchups between Patrick Mahomes II and Josh Allen.  MORE: NFL playoff picture | NFL power rankings | Week NFL picks against the spread The stakes are about the same as usual heading into Sunday's matchup. The Chiefs (9-0) and Bills (8-2) have the two best records in the AFC. Buffalo has a chance to end Kansas City's perfect season, and there likely will be a rematch in the postseason. It also is the toughest pick in a week that also features the AFC North rivalry between the Steelers and Ravens and a Sunday Night Football matchup between the Bengals and Chargers.  Each week, we will pick NFL matchups straight up and against the spread. A look at our track record this season:  Here are our picks for Week 10:  NFL HQ:Live NFL scores | Updated NFL standings | Full NFL schedule Thursday, 8:15 p.m., Amazon Prime This is a fun NFC East matchup on the Thursday Night Football window between two elite NFC offenses. Jayden Daniels has been outstanding on the road this season, with a 76.9-percent completion percentage, seven TDs, and one interception. Can Washington generate enough of a running game against a defense that has allowed just 100 yards rushing one time through a five-game win streak? Jalen Hurts and Saquon Barkley keep the Eagles moving toward contention for the top seed in the NFC.  Pick: Eagles 28, Commanders 21  MORE: Johnny Newton in tears over late-game mistake vs. Steelers Sunday, 1 p.m., Fox  If the Bears want to change the tenor of their season around Caleb Williams, then a victory against Green Bay would be the tonic. Williams has taken 18 sacks in the past three games, but the Packers have had an inconsistent pass rush this season. Green Bay is coming off a bye week, and the Bears have struggled against the run. Expect Josh Jacobs to get a heavy workload, but Chicago hangs around in an all-in moment against their NFC North rivals.  Pick: Packers 27, Bears 22  MORE: Is Matt Eberflus on hot seat? Sunday, 1 p.m., CBS This is tied for the highest spread of the season and the fifth double-digit spread in the NFL this year. The favorite is 3-1 ATS in that situation so far, and Detroit has won its past two home games by an average of 20.5 points per game. Jacksonville has three one-score losses on the road, but they also lost 47-10 at Buffalo. This game could get in that neighborhood with Jared Goff looking to clean up the mistakes after a five-interception performance in Week 10.  Pick: Lions 37, Jaguars 17  MORE: Did Lions get away with key defensive pass interference vs. Texans? Sunday, 1 p.m., CBS The Vikings lead the NFL with 15 interceptions, and Sam Darnold has thrown five INTs in his past two games. The Titans are 31st in the NFL with a -11 turnover ratio. Which team can keep it clean? Justin Jefferson, who hasn't scored a TD in three games, breaks that streak, and the Vikings improve to 4-1 S/U on the road. Aaron Jones (ribs) should be good to go, too.  Pick: Vikings 24, Titans 14 MORE: Vikings taunt Jaguars' mascot after takeaways Sunday, 1 p.m., CBS  The Raiders had a bye week to attempt to reconstruct a brutal season, and the Dolphins are working on a short week after Monday Night Football against the Rams. Las Vegas is 3-0 ATS as an underdog of seven points or more, and Gardner Minshew did not throw an interception in his past two starts. Miami will take advantage of Las Vegas' inability to run the ball, but this still feels like a one-score game.  Pick: Miami 28, Raiders 22 WEEK 11 FANTASY FOOTBALL RANKINGSQBs | RBs | WRs | TEs | D/ST | Kickers Sunday, 1 p.m., Fox  The Rams are 1-3 S/U on the road this season, but the protection for Matthew Stafford has been better in the past four games. He took just one sack in three games ahead of the Monday Night Football matchup against Miami, and the defense is creating more turnovers. Patriots rookie Drake Maye has a 66.7-percent completion percentage in his past two starts, but he will be forced to take more chances here if the Rams get ahead early.  Pick: Rams 22, Patriots 15 Sunday, 1 p.m., Fox  Jameis Winston spent three seasons in New Orleans from 2021-23, and now he'll get the chance to start against his former team coming out of the bye week. The Saints won their first game under interim coach Darren Rizzi, but they have struggled against the run. Nick Chubb could get on track here, and Myles Garrett could build off a three-sack performance in Week 9. Winston leads an emotional road win.  Pick: Browns 23, Saints 20 MORE: Interim coach Darren Rizzi explains why he expected 'crappy day' vs. Falcons Sunday, 1 p.m., CBS Which mess will be cleaned up first? The Colts are stuck in a three-game skid, one in which they have committed eight turnovers. Joe Flacco hasn't quite caught the magic he had in Cleveland last season. The Jets had 207 total yards in a Week 10 loss at Arizona. What is the difference? New York is 2-2 S/U at home with Aaron Rogers, and he has a 100.9 passer rating in those games.  Pick: Jets 24, Colts 17 MORE: Jeff Ulbrich takes blame for loss | Is Aaron Rodgers on hot seat? Sunday, 1 p.m., CBS The classic AFC North rivalry is renewed. The Steelers are winning with a formula Russell Wilson loves — a strong running game led by Najee Harris, a few deep shots to George Pickens, and a reliable defense. How will that stack up against Lamar Jackson and Derrick Henry? Jackson is 1-3 against the Steelers as a starter, and he has taken an average of five sacks in those games. Pittsburgh won seven of the past eight in this series.  Pick: Ravens 21, Steelers 19 MORE STEELERS: Russell Wilson validates Mike Tomlin's QB decision with win over Commanders MORE RAVENS: Kyle Hamilton injury update | Derrick Henry wardrobe malfunction Sunday, 4:05 p.m., Fox  The Falcons are 3-3 S/U on the road, and the Broncos are 2-2 S/U at home. It's a toss-up game, and Cousins has been solid on the road with a 108.2 passer rating. Atlanta has to get Bijan Robinson going against a Broncos' defense that ranks seventh against the run. A victory would give Sean Payton a sweep against the NFC South, and we'll give it to him with a walk-off field goal.  Pick: Broncos 21, Falcons 17 Sunday, 4:05 p.m., Fox  The 49ers are getting healthy with the return of Christian McCaffrey, and Brock Purdy had his second-best passer rating of the season in a 23-20 win against Tampa Bay in Week 10. That's not a coincidence. San Francisco beat Seattle 36-24 in the first meeting. The Seahawks are 2-1 S/U on the road, but they are also 1-3 ATS as an underdog this season.  Pick: 49ers 29, Seahawks 20 MORE: CMC is back — and so is 49ers' Super Bowl offense | Deebo Samuel explains spat with teammates Sunday, 4:25 p.m., CBS  The Bills are on a five-game winning streak, and Allen has played well against the Chiefs throughout his career in the regular season with nine TDs and two interceptions. He averages 41.2 rushing yards in those games. The Chiefs have allowed 76.8 rushing yards per game in their past four games, but they also average 111.8 rushing yards in the same stretch. Mahomes is going to be asked to do more in this game. Mahomes has seven TDs and five INTs with an average of 31.5 rushing yards per game in those regular-season games with the Bills. Both quarterbacks will let it rip in the second half, and we expect the same-as-usual instant classic.  Pick: Chiefs 25, Bills 23 MORE: How Chiefs stayed perfect | Did Patrick Mahomes ask ref for help? | Taylor Swift meets with ref before Chiefs game Sunday, 8:20 p.m., NBC Peacock  The Chargers' turn-around with Jim Harbaugh continues, and it rests on high-percentage offense and a defense that has allowed 17 points or fewer in its six victories. Justin Herbert has a 67.5-percent completion percentage with five TDs and no interceptions through a three-game win streak. Joe Burrow is 65.9 percent with 10 TDs and two interceptions in his past three games, and the Bengals are 1-2. Cincinnati has to have it, and the Chargers have won the past two meetings.  Pick: Bengals 27, Chargers 26 MORE: Ja'Marr Chase's historic performance vs. Ravens | Playoff picture | Missed penalties on final play vs. Ravens  Monday, 8:15 p.m., ABC/ESPN The Cowboys are in a free-fall after managing just 146 total yards in Week 10 against Philadelphia.
